casebody.data:
Beardsley’s Executors against Root.

Where a verconlln^sublion ° of6 Té lob^mld/tbe limited by the sixth rule of Jan. term,1799, as to the time for preparing the case, &c.

THE COURT said, that the sixth rule of January term, 1799, relative to making cases, did not apply where a verdict was taken by consent, subject to the opinion of the court, on a case to be made by the parties; and that the party was not, therefore, confined to the time limited by that rule for preparing his case &C. ’
